item.title: Data Center Site Selection
item.description: Data Center Site Selection (DCSS) is a tool that combines network requirements with geospatial analysis to identify the best location for a new data center. DCSS takes into account factors such as network connectivity, power availability, and environmental risks to help organizations make informed decisions about where to locate their data centers. By using DCSS, organizations ensure that their data centers are located in the optimal location to meet their specific needs.

item.title: Overture
item.description:
Customize the public UDF to extract data from Overture Maps.

Add the option to grab data from a polygon and convert polygons to points.

Over the past year we have advised on the development of the Fused Platform.

The Fused Platform is a data platform that allows users to access data from multiple sources and combine it into a single data set. All via using Python code that is already being used by data scientists and analysts.
